title: Drawing, "Painted Ceiling", ca. 1590
medium:
Pen and brown ink, brown wash, over black chalk
Support: off-white laid paper
markings: Marks: Two crossed arrows, similiar to Heawood 33
inscribed: Inscribed in brown ink, clockwise from top center margin: Biancho; right center: figura; lower center: giallo rosso; lower margin: merello; lower left margin: Bigio chiaro; left margin: Viara; left center margin: figura; left upper margin: Notte [---]bi
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Painted Ceiling", ca. 1590.
ca. 1590. Pen and brown ink, brown wash, over black chalk
Support: off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-479.
